basic_info.headline: Working on something new | YC founder | ML & Computer Vision
basic_info.about:
My name is F-G (short for François-Guillaume 🇫🇷), a Y Combinator-backed entrepreneur with a strong background in machine learning and automation. I'm currently exploring new startup opportunities and seeking exceptional cofounders who share my philosophy of building lean, high-impact products.

On the technical side, people who know me well would say I'm the go-to person for:
- computer vision & deep learning: formerly top contributor to PyTorch, built & trained SOTA vision models for instance segmentation & document understanding
- developer libraries: authored several Python libraries that unexpected took off on GitHub - open-source lover here 👋
- IoT & visual intelligence: co-founded Pyronear, an NGO using deep learning on Raspberry Pi for wildfire detection

One thing you should know: my front-end skills are a work-in-progress. Fortunately, I'm a driven learner and Cursor + Claude Sonnet + fancy MCPs are pulling me out of my inexperience.

I'm now actively seeking ambitious cofounders! If you're excited about building something tangible, in-person, and fast, let's talk 🤙

basic_info.headline: Building My Next Venture | Exploring Opportunities | Open to Cofounder Roles & Collaborations | Ex-Head of Cloud Products at Yanolja | Leadership Roles | AI Tools Pro | Product Strategy | ClickUp Expert | Startup Curious
basic_info.about:
Former Head of Cloud Products at Yanolja Cloud Solutions | Startup-Ready | AI Tools Pro | Product & Growth Strategy | ClickUp Expert

With 17+ years of experience in building scalable, secure cloud solutions, leading high-performing teams, and driving end-to-end product strategy, I’m currently exploring new opportunities—whether it’s launching my own venture, joining as a co-founder, or collaborating with a team that’s solving meaningful problems.

At Yanolja Cloud Solutions (formerly eZee Technosys), I led the Cloud Department, bringing strong product vision, hands-on execution, and the ability to bridge tech, strategy, and operations. I’ve helped teams scale and innovate across cloud-based platforms through a mix of AI, automation, and smart tooling like ClickUp.

What I bring to the table : 
    1. Strategic Product Vision with Strong Execution
    2. Agile Leadership (Certified Scrum Master)
    3. Tooling & Productivity (ClickUp Expert)
    4. Cross-functional Team Building & Mentorship
    5. Innovation & Process Optimization

I’m idea-rich and execution-focused - passionate about turning ideas into action, solving real-world problems through tech-enabled products, and collaborating with startup-minded teams to build something impactful.

Open to:
    Co-founder / Founding Team Roles
    Product Leadership or Strategy Consulting
    Collaborations with Early-stage Startups or Innovation Teams

Let’s connect if you're building something exciting, exploring a product idea, or just want to exchange thoughts on tech, teams, or startups.

basic_info.headline: CEO & co-founder of LUX Rewards and Lyfe Wellbeing | EntreConf's Fintech of the Year (2024) and Young Entrepreneur (2023) | Insider’s 42under42 | RMI's 30under30 | Hurun's Future Stars | Executive MBA Candidate
basic_info.about:
Resilience, self-belief and relentless optimism. 

Three key characteristics that helped me keep my sanity during the pandemic, which decimated the hospitality sector in which my first venture (LUX Rewards) originally operated. 

In Spring 2021, we re-started in earnest. 
Refreshed and refuelled. 
A new management team. 
A new vision for the business. 

We took what we had built and moved into B2B enterprise. In the following 24 months, we achieved what we hadn't been able to do in the previous 3 years. We grew revenues to over £5million in ARR and now promote card-linked offers to over 105 million payment cards globally, via partnerships with major financial institutions, airlines, employee benefit platforms and reward schemes. 

We are building market-leading rewards scheme technology and solutions. 
B2B focussed. Technology driven. 

We also raised multi-seven-figure investment to fund our growth. 

--------------------------------------------

Achievements:
- RMI 30under30 (Restaurant Marketer & Innovator)
- Hurun's Future Stars
- Top 42 entrepreneurs under 42 by Insider SW
- Multi-seven-figure in equity investment secured throughout the lifetime of the business
- Top Ten Entrepreneurs to Watch in 2017 by #1 Global University Accelerator, SETsquared
- Two time Bath Business Plan competition winner & UoB Dragons' Den winner
- Sparkies Awards: Finalist of the Best App category and James Courtney for FutureSpark award
- Creative Bath Awards: Finalist in the Best App category and James Courtney for Young Creative
- Ten months at IBM working on Social Media Analytics & engaging with innovation days
- Six months at Unilever working on Global Marketing Strategy
- A summer at PwC as a Management Consultant
- A year at Filament as an AI Strategist (product mgmt, strategy consulting & marketing)
- Graduated with a First in BSc. Business at the University of Bath

--------------------------------------------

How it all began: https://www.bath.ac.uk/case-studies/a-rewarding-idea-how-baths-entrepreneurial-spirit-helped-me-launch-my-business/

Alongside achieving a First-class hons in Business Administration, James launched his first venture and became the first student ever to win the Bath Business Plan Competition two years in a row. This gave him the opportunity to travel to New York and SF to meet inspirational Alumni at Facebook, Google, Harvard Business School, Betaworks and various tech startups.

This inspired James to turn down the grad job offers and start his own business. He successfully raised his first investment round during his University studies.

experience.title: Founder & CEO
experience.description:
**LUX has generated over £100,000,000 (yes, one hundred million pounds!) for partnered brands**

LUX Rewards is a key player in the Card-Linked Offers sector. We promote brands to over 105 million payment cards across the UK and US via partnerships with major airlines, banks, employee benefit platforms, cashback sites and premium rewards schemes. 

James founded LUX whilst completing his Business Management degree at the University of Bath, at the age of 21. Using his experience as a management consultant for IBM and PwC, he spotted a gap in the restaurant promotion market for a premium alternative to discounting. He led the business through multiple equity funding rounds, totalling seven-figures and including investment from JUST EAT Plc.

Post-covid, he pivoted the business into the B2B space. This moved LUX away from being a consumer app and now focusses on working in partnership with major airlines and banks. This strategic shift has transformed the business, with revenue growing by over 100x in a 2 year period.

Lyfe Rewards is a flexible and modular rewards platform that facilitates multiple use cases for you to deliver seamless rewards schemes to your customers.

experience.title: Global Business Analyst
experience.description:
James was given the opportunity to understand how a large company co-ordinates its marketing efforts across the world. Being placed in a small, dynamic team James  produced high-quality work for SVP's and even Paul Polman (CEO) himself.

This six month internship with Unilever formed part of his University course. James was chosen to work in the Global HQ team which sets the strategy for Unilever's country-based teams across the world. Working in a small agile team, James took on a large amount of responsibility and interacted with senior stakeholders worldwide. His main tasks were split into 4 areas:

1. Competitive & Market Intelligence – Enabled growth delivery of the Oral Care team (leadership + brand developers + markets) through facilitating deep understanding of competitor strategy and foresight of their likely actions from a global perspective

2. Category Strategy & Docking - Supported the deployment of the Oral Care category strategy through comprehensively briefing senior leadership on market insight and key issues present in the top Unilever markets 

3. Category Communications - Aligned the Global Oral Care organization to Oral Care category strategy, Personal Care strategy & Unilever Sustainable Living Plan through internal and external communication

4. Events & Stimuli - Independently organised an 'Experience Indonesia' event which gets the team closer to the consumer. Enabled teams to deliver brilliant brand development through providing tangible stimuli reflecting the reality of Unilever's key businesses around the world

This involved regularly communicating with client executives to gather the requirements, managing team members, developing expertise in the tool, creating the presentation and presenting the results to internal teams. 

Assisting my manager on a number of business development opportunities with existing clients has given me experience in bidding for high value projects.

I have received excellent feedback for my work at IBM, especially from my Task Manager (Justin Ablett) who commented “James has been an absolute star. His efforts and achievements are of the highest I have seen of any Foundation professional (including Futures student, ITs and Grads) - I would have him on my team any day.”

My main role was to build Business Intelligence and Analytics (BI) business cases. This involved meeting key stakeholders, building a benefits case and  a Business Requirements Specification (BRS). I was trusted throughout the project to engage on a daily basis with clients and organised educational sessions for our internal team.

I received excellent feedback from my manager:
"He operates at the level of a very good graduate entry into IBM and considering his youth he should be rightfully proud of the maturity of approach that he brings in to the work place."

given_recommendations.recommendation_text:
I'd like to extend my deepest gratitude to Justas for his outstanding contributions during his tenure of over 2 years at our company. From the onset, I saw Justas adapt and thrive amidst challenging circumstances and continuous evolution within the business. The significant success we've witnessed as business in recent months can be attributed in part to his tangible and invaluable inputs.

Beyond his professional prowess, what sets Justas apart is his innate sense of empathy and camaraderie. His ability to discern when a colleague might be going through a tough time, his proactive suggestions for team bonding, and his impeccable timing to bring levity to our work environment speaks volumes of his character. Operating in a role like operations, which at times can be undervalued, Justas has displayed tremendous resilience, growth, and an admirable honesty. His eagerness to learn and develop stands as a testament to his professional commitment.

While it's with a heavy heart that we bid farewell to such an integral team member, I'm confident that his journey ahead will be laden with success and accomplishments. Justas, always remember that you have a special place within the LUX family, and our support extends far beyond the confines of the office. Your future endeavours will undoubtedly have us rooting for you, and Visa is indeed fortunate to have someone of your calibre on board.

Wishing you the very best in your next chapter, Justas. Your legacy here will be long remembered and cherished by us all.

honors.title: Winner - Bath Business Plan Competition
honors.description:
http://www.bath.ac.uk/news/2015/03/30/fast-food-discount-card-tops-student-business-plan-competition/

"James Courtney  wins a week-long trip to New York and Boston to network with Bath alumni in some of the world’s biggest companies.

James based his idea on the successful and rapidly growing business model of the Tastecard restaurant discount scheme, applying it to premium fast food outlets.

Organised by Enterprise Bath, the Students' Union Enterprise Department, the competition attracted over 50 ideas. Competitors entered a speed dating event to be paired with a business mentor and attended a business dinner hosted by sponsors Deloitte.

They had the opportunity to pitch their plan to Bath graduates now working as consultants at Deloitte, to receive valuable feedback ahead of the final presentation of their fincancial projections and business and marketing strategies to the panel of judges. 

A panel of top business judges were impressed by James’ thorough and detailed plan, and the quality of his presentation. Colin Clarkson-Short, Partner at Deloitte, and Head of Consulting for the South West and Wales, said: "Deloitte has supported the Business Plan Competition for the last nine years and each year the standard has got better. This year it was hard to separate the four finalists. All had prepared comprehensive viable plans, gave great presentations, and demonstrated a commitment to launch within the next six months. James’ plan just had the edge with the right depth and detail across all the required elements. He is a worthy winner."

James was mentored by Bath and Deloitte alumnus Matt Parfitt, now Senior Accountant – Employee Taxes at Nationwide, who added: “James needed very little guidance as he had already done so much work and was so passionate about his idea it that it made my role very easy. I immensely enjoyed teaming up with James - working with someone with such contagious passion for something is a truly inspirational experience.”"

volunteering-experiences.title: Volunteer in Costa Rica
volunteering-experiences.description:
The main element of my expedition was volunteering in a poor indigenous village, where I helped build a Comedor for the local school. It was touching how much a difference we made and how well we managed to integrate with the families there. Following this we successfully completed a five day trek across rain forests and up mountains. Undoubtedly some of the hardest but most rewarding days of my life.

The expedition had a strong emphasis on personal development and I was frequently given the opportunity to be the day leader. This stretched and improved my leadership skills as I had to motivate a large group of people to work together through some of the most challenging moments of their lives. On top of standard organisation responsibilities such as time keeping, I created and ran 'energisers' (small games) to develop teamwork and coordinated effective reviews so that we could continuously develop the ways in which we worked together. 

If you would like to find out more about my work in Costa Rica, please follow this link:

http://www.raleighinternational.org/where-we-work/costa-rica-nicaragua

basic_info.headline: AI Innovator | Founder & CEO of Ready Tensor | 20+ Years in Data Science & AI |
basic_info.about:
Hi, I’m Abhyuday ("Abu") Desai, Founder and CEO of Ready Tensor. With 20+ years in data science and AI, including leadership roles at Verint Systems and Kiran Analytics, I’m passionate about building practical, impactful AI solutions.

At Ready Tensor, we’re creating a platform for AI/ML professionals to share real projects and foster hands-on learning. From certification programs to open competitions, we’re supporting a growing community of builders and educators.

Let’s advance AI together. Learn more at www.readytensor.ai.

experience.title: Founder, CEO
experience.description:
As Founder and CEO of Ready Tensor, Inc., I lead a platform that empowers AI professionals to showcase their work and collaborate with peers. Our mission is to advance the field through knowledge sharing and community engagement.

I oversee the development of open-source tools leveraging generative AI technologies to help our community effectively document and share their AI/ML projects. By fostering a dynamic community that values both innovation and responsible AI practices, Ready Tensor supports professionals at all stages of their AI journey.

With extensive experience in AI and analytics leadership, I am committed to building a platform that serves the evolving needs of the AI community. Join us at Ready Tensor to share your projects, connect with fellow innovators, and contribute to advancing the field of AI.

experience.title: Vice President of Product - DaVinci AI
experience.description: As Vice President of Product for DaVinci AI at Verint Systems, I led the strategy for AI and machine learning initiatives, focusing on creating practical AI solutions. I directed the development of reusable AI engines and drove their adoption across the product portfolio. Working with cross-functional teams, I ensured our AI products delivered tangible business value while meeting high standards for innovation and reliability.

experience.title: Vice President, Analytics
experience.description: Led the analytics and data science team in developing advanced workforce management solutions for large retail networks. Overseeing business consulting, R&D, and business development initiatives, I focused on creating and implementing innovative analytics methodologies that delivered actionable insights across retail, banking, hospitality, and food and beverage industries. My leadership in developing cutting-edge analytics solutions helped establish Kiran Analytics as a leader in AI-driven business process optimization.

experience.title: Director of Analytics
experience.description: As Director of Analytics at Kiran Analytics, I developed analytics methodologies and led business intelligence initiatives across retail banking, hospitality, and food and beverage sectors. I directed the team in creating innovative solutions that provided actionable insights and improved decision-making processes for our clients.

experience.title: Senior Consultant
experience.description: As Senior Consultant at Kiran Analytics, I developed and implemented analytics solutions and decision-making tools for clients in retail banking and hospitality, focusing on aligning technical solutions with business objectives.

experience.title: Consultant
experience.description: Delivered data-driven solutions to help clients improve operations and decision-making across multiple industries.

projects.name: Benchmarking Study on Forecasting Models
projects.description: Led a comprehensive benchmarking project that evaluated a wide range of forecasting techniques, including traditional models, machine learning models, neural networks, and LLM-based models such as Amazon Science's Chronos. This study assessed 100+ models across 24 datasets using various metrics like RMSE, RMSSE, and sMAPE. The project provided key insights into the effectiveness of different forecasting models and highlighted the growing potential of large-scale, pretrained models in time series forecasting.

projects.name: Reproducibility in AI/ML Research
projects.description:
Co-authored with Mohamed Abdelhamid and Nakul R. Padalkar
Developed a framework addressing the ongoing reproducibility crisis in AI/ML. Our paper introduced a structured framework clarifying key terms like repeatability, reproducibility, and replicability. This contribution is aimed at fostering clearer validation methodologies within AI research, ultimately improving the reliability of AI innovations.

projects.name: TimeVAE: A Variational Auto-Encoder for Multivariate Time Series Generation
projects.description:
Co-authored with Cynthia Freeman, Zuhui Wang, Ian Beaver
Developed a novel VAE-based architecture for generating synthetic time-series data. TimeVAE offers distinct advantages, including interpretability, the ability to encode domain knowledge, and reduced training times. Our evaluation showed that TimeVAE effectively represents the temporal attributes of original data, outperforming state-of-the-art methods in next-step prediction tasks using generated data. The architecture's ability to incorporate domain-specific time-patterns makes it a powerful tool for applications requiring interpretable and high-quality synthetic data generation.

given_recommendations.recommendation_text:
I had the wonderful opportunity of working with Kenny this summer (June-Aug. 2022). He worked on my team as a Machine Learning Engineer Intern. 
Kenny is a very talented data scientist. We tasked him with creating algorithm implementations for the general classification and text classification problems. Kenny produced numerous production-quality implementations in Python using frameworks like Scikit-Learn and Pytorch. He also delivered a HuggingFace model (DistilBert) for sentiment classification, created within a Docker container, and with a web-service for inference. 
It is rare to see a young data scientist possess the knowledge, maturity and patience to create these sophisticated models, not just in Jupyter Notebooks, but in a way that is packaged for deployment. Any employer would be lucky to have Kenny as a part of their team. 
Kenny has my full endorsement!

basic_info.headline: Founder/CEO @ Stealth Mode Startup
basic_info.about:
As the founder and CEO of a stealth mode startup, I leverage my multidisciplinary background and expertise in new business development to create innovative solutions for the global market. I have over 14 years of experience as an entrepreneur, leading and advising multiple companies across different industries and sectors. My entrepreneurial career began at age 20 when I launched my first company, Fesa Enterprises, a specialty retail company with sixteen mall kiosks along the West Coast. In 2007, I  became managing director and adviser for One Planet Education Network (OPEN), an international educational technology company that brings dynamic learning to students via the Internet. 

At 15, I received a scholarship to attend Bard College at Simon's Rock. Instead, at 16, I  decided to attend law school in Brazil at PUC-Rio. Later, I pursued a double major in Philosophy and Financial Economics with a concentration in Computer Science at Columbia University.

basic_info.headline: HealthTech Pioneer as Investor and Innovator | Founder and Managing Director @ HealthTech Capital | Mentor Capitalist, Healthcare Strategy Expert | Artist.
basic_info.about:
Anne DeGheest pioneered the HealthTech or Digital Health space as a healthcare executive, an entrepreneur, angel investor, corporate advisor and mentor capitalist. She is the founder of HealthTech Capital and MedStars. She is a recognized leader on how to successfully build innovative HealthTech businesses and change healthcare delivery. 

Since she founded MedStars in 1986, she has been a corporate development advisor to large healthcare companies and a mentor capitalist specializing in investing and mentoring early-stage companies in healthcare. Her life science portfolio companies have generated over $27 billion in market capitalization , including 8 IPOs. She provided angel capital, hands-on operating expertise and/or business strategy in the founding of major venture-backed companies like Pyxis (CareFusion), Aspect Medical (acquired by Covidien), VISX (acquired by AMO), Thermage (merged into Solta Medical), VISICU(acquired by Philips), Masimo (Nasdaq: MASI). She also helped grow new entrepreneurial divisions of large corporations like ASP/Johnson & Johnson, Baxter, Medtronic and McKesson. She was also part of the founding executive team of Nellcor (a division of Covidien), MedPool and OmniCell (Nasdaq: OMCL). She was an Entrepreneur-In-Residence with Canaan Partners and IVP.

Anne founded in 2010 HealthTech Capital, a group of private investors dedicated to funding and mentoring new "HealthTech" startups to decrease healthcare cost and empower patients. HealthTech capital is an ecosystem of angels, venture capitalists, providers, payors and healthcare industry key players with the three sets of expertise needed to succeed in this new HealthTech space: healthcare, technology and user engagement.

Anne is also a recognized artist (www.adegheest.com).  She is a frequent speaker at industry conferences and a guest-lecturer at Stanford Business School.  She has an MBA from Harvard and a master's in business engineering from University of Brussels.

basic_info.headline: Co-founder@MagIC lifescience | Stanford MBA | Entrepreneur | Forbes China 100 (2024)| Biopharma & Medtech Professional
basic_info.about:
Inspired by my heritage in traditional Chinese medicine, I've spent over 15 years navigating the dynamic intersection of science, healthcare, and business. My journey spans roles in leading pharmaceutical companies (GSK, Pfizer, J&J), venture capital investment in healthcare innovation, and entrepreneurship as the co-founder of a venture-backed medical device company.

Throughout my career, I've thrived in positions that blend scientific rigor with strategic business acumen—helping startups scale from 0 to 1, and guiding established enterprises from 1 to 100. My passion lies in driving sustainable growth and bringing affordable, impactful healthcare solutions to market, ultimately helping people feel better and live healthier, longer lives.

On Saturday, 20 June 2015 Level39 of Canary Wharf’s iconic One Canada Square will play host to the inaugural TEDxCanaryWharf: Emerging Cultures and Ideas event – an unmissable day dedicated to groundbreaking ideas, and the new cultures being formed around them. 

London is a melting pot of people and ideas, and nowhere is that more apparent than in Tower Hamlets – in the diversity of its inhabitants, in the rich history of the docklands, and in the financial houses that make up the iconic Canary Wharf skyline. Given this dynamic, TEDxCanaryWharf aims to fuel important conversations and actions in this area of London; to empower and inspire communities, creative leaders, businesses and other stakeholders to embrace emerging cultures and ideas, for the benefit of all.

basic_info.headline: Building something new
basic_info.about:
I’m Björn Bakker! 👋 I started as a professional race car driver competing with the world's best— then a broken back (+7 other bones) changed everything…

It was a brutal wake-up call, but I channeled my competitive nature, drive, and results-first mindset into building my first company.

By 24, I’d developed specialized nanotech solutions for industrial furnaces, saving manufacturers millions in energy costs and earning my first exit.

That taste of entrepreneurship set the stage for what came next. I realized I had a knack for spotting inefficiencies and solving problems in novel ways.

That’s why I got into tech, and now I've been working in this industry for over a decade (ok almost 2 decades).

I’ve led 3 successful exits, scaled 3 businesses to $100M ARR, and led teams to develop innovative solutions that save companies millions in operational costs.

Today, I'm building something new (currently in stealth). 

Follow my profile if you want to see what's next.

You’ll also find me here sharing thoughts on startup culture, turnarounds, leadership, and my daily rants about life and business—unfiltered, no fluff, just the hard truths and lessons I’ve learned along the way.✌️

education.description:
The altMBA is an online leadership and management workshop. Each session of the workshop is led by a cadre of coaches, who engage with students in individual and group work. Reaching the next level of leadership requires a shift in posture, in decision-making, and, most of all, in choosing to be a linchpin. 
Without guidance, this process can take years of trial-and-error. The altMBA accelerates this personal and professional transformation by providing a deep view of leadership, organizations, and change.

Following a competitive selection process, the altMBA delivers a condensed learning experience through teamwork, personalized feedback, coaching, curated readings, and shipping 13 projects in 4 weeks to take fast-tracked leaders to the next level.

Six months later, I landed a software engineering job at Google, and at the same time, I launched AlgoExpert—an online platform that helps Software Engineers prepare for technical interviews.

basic_info.headline: Founder & Managing Partner | Driving AI Innovation in Healthcare | Investor in Health-Tech Companies
basic_info.about:
I’m deeply committed to transforming healthcare through the responsible use of AI and advanced technology. My work centers on building scalable, impactful solutions that improve patient outcomes, support healthcare professionals, and modernize the care ecosystem. 

My journey began after seeing the effects of misdiagnosis within my own family, an experience that led to a lifelong mission to make healthcare safer, smarter, and more humane. That mission guided me from founding and selling an AI startup to now shaping strategic growth efforts at the intersection of AI, data, and healthcare innovation.

Our focus is global. Our approach is collaborative. And our vision is bold: a healthcare system where technology works for everyone: patients, providers, and innovators alike. 

Let’s connect if you're working on something that can change the world, or if you want to be part of one that is.

honors.title: International Visitor Leadership Program - Women and Entrepreneurship
honors.issuer: United States Department of State and CRDF Global
honors.description:
The U.S. Department of State helps to shape a freer, more secure, and more prosperous world through formulating, representing, and implementing the President’s foreign policy. The Secretary of State is the President’s principal adviser on foreign policy and the person chiefly responsible for U.S. representation abroad.

The Bureau of Educational and Cultural Affairs fosters mutual understanding between the United States and other countries through international educational, professional and cultural exchanges. The Bureau promotes personal, professional and institutional ties between private citizens and organizations in the United States and abroad, and presents U.S. history, society, art and culture in all of its diversity to overseas audiences.

The Office of International Visitors manages and funds the International Visitor Leadership Program (IVLP). Launched in 1940, the IVLP seeks to build mutual understanding between the United States and other nations through carefully designed professional visits to the United States for current and emerging foreign leaders. These visits reflect the visitors’ professional interests and support the foreign policy goals of the U.S. government. Through these encounters, they gain a greater understanding of the cultural and political influences in U.S. society and enjoy a firsthand experience of the United States, its people, and its culture. Visitors represent government, politics, the media, education, non-governmental organizations, the arts, public health, international security, business and trade, and other fields. Over 320 current and former heads of government and state and many other distinguished world leaders in the public and private sectors have participated in the International Visitor Leadership Program.

This is the main conference, organized once a year, as well as collateral initiatives uniting the community around the idea of TED, like our monthly meetups and TedxAdventures.

In addition to the main conference we also organize a series of smaller events. Kazimierz is full of interesting people - activists, artists and thinkers. We want to give them a chance to present their ideas to the general public and intoxicate the audience with concepts of growth, innovation and tolerance regardless of age, religion, orientation or beliefs.

The TEDxKazimierz philosophy fits in with the historically diverse characteristics of this district by opening the stage to experiencing and embracing the multi-colored and often difficult history of Kazimierz.

I led the team of eight people, created a vision, strategy and goals for TEDx Kazimierz project. I produced marketing content and press releases that resulted in 150% overbooking in the number of submitted applications for tickets. The conference itself was planned for 220 people and we have a full house.
The publications appeared in well known media, such as Interia.pl, Onet.pl, Radio Kraków and many others. We cooperated with the Marshall Office and the Krakow City Office.

I am passionate about startups, venture capital and technology. My professional career has been a journey through innovation and problem solving within organizations in which I have played an "Intrapreneur" role, that is, I am not limited to a single role. I have worked in different areas and many times I have served as the bridge that connects teams, ensuring that everything flows towards a common goal.

I consider myself a curious person with a "make things happen" mentality. I don't always have all the answers or skills from the start, but my proactivity and autonomy drive me to find effective solutions, whatever the challenge.

I mainly work in growth, product and business development roles. In addition, I spend time building community and generating opportunities for those around me, building long-term relationships that enhance the entrepreneurial ecosystem.

experience.title: Co-Founder
experience.description:
Trifecta is the nations largest organic meal delivery service, and ships millions of meals to all 50 states. Our team sources fresh, organic ingredients, and then cooks and ships them for deliveries nationwide. 

Recent studies have pointed to convenience as the #1 reason American's are overweight, above education, poverty, and all other factors. (http://www.forbes.com/sites/bethhoffman/2012/07/17/its-convenience-not-cost-that-makes-us-fat/)

Our company mission is to get America back into shape, and eventually to fundamentally change the food supply chain to improve animal welfare, reduce shipping costs, and eliminate all packaging.

How Trifecta Works:

You live a busy life, and making eating healthy day in and day out, every meal of the day, extremely difficult. Instead of grocery shopping, cooking, washing dishes, or spending hundreds eating out, Trifecta buys the highest quality Organic ingredients available on the market, our chefs cook them to perfection, and we delivery them directly to your door.

Our meals are never frozen, and are vacuum sealed immediately after being made, chilled overnight in our walk in fridges, and sent Fedex Next Day Air directly to your door. We offer free shipping to all 50 states, and our meals are perfectly macronutrient balanced so you can eat healthier than you ever have before in your life, easier than you ever have before in your life.

experience.title: Founder / CEO
experience.description:
Amara was a first of it's kind Sports / Energy drink designed to displace high sugar, low quality ingredient sports and energy drinks like Gatorade and Rockstar. 

Amara was scaled to over 1,000 retailers including Whole Foods, BevMo, Total Wine, Raley's, and many more while managing a large e-commerce presence that drop most of the brands growth and visibility. The brand secured partnerships with CrossFit, The Paleo Diet, and over 50 celebrity athletes and influencers/creators that helped spread wide visibility of the brand across all marketing channels.

This was my first foray out of the software world and into the CPG / e-Commerce world. Ultimately it lead to the launch of Trifecta via the partnership with The Paleo Diet. Within 5 months of launching Trifecta as a sister company, Trifecta grew so quickly that it outstripped Amara's 5 year ARR and the investor group and leadership team decided to roll Amara's shareholder base into Trifecta and focus on Trifecta as the core business.

experience.title: Sales Director
experience.description:
SmartTurn™, now part of DiCentral, is a leading cloud inventory and warehouse management system (WMS). Our solution, the SmartTurn, increases the visibility and control of inventory. With SmartTurn, DiCentral is best fit for companies looking to better manager their supply chain operations, regardless of size and level of complexity.

Designed for quick implementation, ease-of-use, and real-time inventory accuracy, the SmartTurn solution is a true, multi-tenant WMS delivered via the Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) model. The system provides immediate information on the quantity, location, and status of every inventory item at anytime, anywhere, eliminating costly paperwork errors and streamlining operations. From multiple warehouse locations to individual stockrooms, we help companies maintain a competitive advantage by reducing inventory costs, improving productivity, and increasing customer satisfaction.

SmartTurn was originally founded in 2004 as a division of Navis LLC. Navis is the world-wide leading provider of logistics systems for marine container terminal management, yard management, and logistics asset management systems. While working with Navis customers such as AP Moeller Terminals, Dubai Ports World, Wal-Mart, Coca Cola Bottling, Johnson & Johnson, PepBoys and other leading supply chain companies, it became apparent that vast number of small and medium sized companies who co-exist or partner in the global supply chain with these major players were in need of a system that addressed their needs. From this observation, SmartTurn was born with the mission of providing an inventory and warehouse management system that fit the requirements of the small to medium supply chain player, delivered it within a cost and risk profile which matches their world, yet still has the flexibility, functionality and power to address even large high volume facilities.

experience.title: Senior District Manager
experience.description:
ADP is the nations largest payroll and backend business services provider. 

Solutions expert at ADP where I managed accounts via 12 banks and worked with hundreds of business owners in the SMB division to help them structure and organize their backend business services with ADP. Developed many of the relationships with colleagues who went on to become some of the most successful CEO's in the San Francisco Bay Area.

basic_info.about: I'm a curious and ambitious person with a strong belief in technology's potential to effect meaningful societal change at unprecedented scale. Throughout my career, I’ve helped build scrappy startups and billion-user products at global companies, led cross-functional teams in multiple countries, and worked across a wide range of domains – conversational AI, online marketplaces, hardware, media and entertainment, EVs, education, and beyond. I’m passionate about driving innovation and leading high-impact teams to solve meaningful problems.

experience.title: Product Manager
experience.description: Series G

experience.title: Teaching Team, The Future of Cities: Entrepreneurship, Policy & Business Strategy
experience.description:
Cities are where billions of people live and are engines for innovation and economic growth. They are also going through enormous change and battling with fundamental issues related to housing, transportation, urban planning, the environment, safety, transparency and more. Innovation offers the promise of exciting solutions. But for that change to happen, it must serve the interests of the people who live in cities and overcome the challenges of politics and policymaking. 

Our course focuses on this intersection. We analyze cities as a distinct phenomenon, look at what is possible technologically, and explore how change can be brought about. Offered by the Political Economy group at the Graduate School of Business.

basic_info.headline: Founder, Startup CTO, AI Innovator, SXSW 2024 Finalist
basic_info.about:
As a Latinx tech leader for two decades, I am still surprised and frustrated by the lack of diversity in the space. As we build momentum in artificial intelligence, in distributed trust and in scaled automation, it becomes all the more important to bring new and diverse voices to the table.

Look around. If your company isn't led as much by inclusion as it is by the bottom line, then it will fail at both.

This isn't a traditional LinkedIn bio. I get that. But if people who look like me don't *start* this conversation, I don't know who else will. 

Let's change the world together.

She's a great modeler - able to take what might be a back-of-the-napkin idea and turn it into, well, a testable and repeatable model. I worked with Lynze at Sprinklr but she was there first. Her reputation preceded her - and when I finally met her I didn't know what to expect but I certainly didn't expect someone so humble and thoughtful. It's hard to find that at startups. 

Lynze was both a genius at sales and a genius at managing people. When Sprinklr acquired my company, she was one of the people who made that possible at all - from onboarding to higher-level syncing of company culture. It was no surprise what happened next - from Sprinklr becoming a unicorn to Lynze moving beyond to follow her own passions. 

It's no wonder she's so successful at connecting people to what makes them great. Lynze's superppower is seeing through a mess of bureaucracy or lingo or half-baked ideas into what's great - be that about a product or about an opportunity or most importantly about a person. She's smart as heck and more importantly she's always going to get things done.

As the founder and exited CEO of Xenesis, I dedicated my career to advancing space-based optical communications technologies. My journey began in data science, where I worked on special projects for organizations such as ExxonMobil, Google, Apple, the Airlines Reporting Corporation (ARC), and the United States Air Force Research Laboratory (AFRL). These experiences provided me with a solid foundation in data analysis and technology development.

Prior to establishing Xenesis, I worked at the Official Airline Guide, focusing on commercializing global aviation datasets. During this time, I envisioned a global flight tracking solution that utilized satellite technology to modernize flight tracking systems. Recognizing the critical nature and volume of data involved, I shifted my focus from data creation to developing the world's first commercial optical data transport provider. This led to the founding of Xenesis, where we pioneered the delivery of a global optical multilayered mesh network system. Having exited Xenesis ... I am pursuing new passions in data and Team building.

General Skills : Strategic Pursuit Leader, Pursuit Strategy / Win Strategy, Complex deal pursuit, Enterprise sales, IT services industry, Consulting sales, High-value proposals, Client Growth, , Business and Technology Consulting, Solution Design and Orchestration, Customer Relationship Management, Cross-Functional Collaboration, First Principles

Experience : Strategic Account Engagement, Value Proposition Development, Stakeholder Alignment, Deal Shaping and Execution, Competitive Landscape Analysis, Client Engagement and Relationship Management, Complex Sales Cycle Management, Multi-Solution Integration, Technology Transformation, Business Outcome-Driven Solutions

Technology & Industry Knowledge : Cloud computing, Data analytics, Cybersecurity, Network infrastructure, Enterprise Applications, Digital Transformation, Artificial Intelligence (AI) Solutions, Telecommunications, Complex Architectures, Networks, Meshed Networks, RAN/DTN, Hybrid Architectures, ConOps Design

Soft Skills & Leadership : 
Communication and Presentation
Relationship-Building with C-suite & Stakeholders
Collaboration Across Multi-Disciplinary Teams
Fast-paced Dynamic Work Environment Adaptability
Influencing & Facilitating Internal & External Alignment

projects.name: Google One Box
projects.description: Google OneBox gives users access to real-time data through a simple, fast, and easy to configure search interface. A OneBox defines a search type, the keyword that invokes the search, and the way that a search appliance obtains and returns information after a user invokes a search. You can define any number of OneBox modules, and a user search page can display results from multiple OneBox modules.

basic_info.headline: President and Founder at Stealth-mode Startup
basic_info.about:
Position desired: Chief Technical Officer

I've been an employee or consultant to 15+ Silicon Valley companies from Enterprise to startup. 

During one period, I worked on seven network management software systems for seven companies.  During another period, I educated other software engineers concerning I18N and worked on internationalizing software at several consecutive software companies (a BIOS developer, a genetic science startup, a company making an Enterprise database abstraction layer, an advisor to 3rd party Bay-Area software developers, a German company developing a time-tracking system, and a few others).

I have also brought three products to market myself (and with some contractors).  I'm currently working on the fourth.product.  I did the Full Stage Life-cycle development, marketing, and sales.

I feel very experienced, because I have seen so much software in different stages of development. I identify design or testing weaknesses, implementation or benchmark issues, and address those problems.  I talk constructively with involved engineers and management, and give good presentations.

I have led several terms, one for NCR Micrographics, and for my own products.

Because of all of this technical exposure and the skill I've gained in the navigation of people and personalities to accomplish different projects, I am seeking a company which needs an experienced, stabilizing manager to successfully create, finish, and deliver great products, mentor employees, and use appropriate methodologies and metrics.  I am committed to your success.

-----------------------------

Portfolio and some code at MLSchaffer.com  Like all good websites, it is under constant improvement and is a work in progress.

experience.description: Recruiting key staff members. Getting their buy-in by presenting the Concept and answering questions.  Defining the work to be done and the schedule.  Contributing to the product by creating and writing front- and back-end code.  Creating a presentation for potential investors. Affirmatively motivating the Team.

experience.title: CTO of Mobile Design
experience.description: After creating a group of ideas for unrelated Apps I might uniquely improve, I decided to implement the one with the shortest time to market. The first App will create a subtle ambience for the workplace or home.

experience.title: Lead UI Engineer
experience.description:
I briefly worked at Sezmi with "the Mobile Team." I used jQuery Mobile and a Grid control while maintaining the existing UI Theme to improve the App's screen utilization of the tablet platform.  I showed a contractor how to fix the HTML  and CSS for a webapp. This made use of the device in portrait or landscape mode function correctly.

A Senior team member was so excited when I demonstrated my change to one page's presentation of the UI, she grabbed the tablet out of my hands and burst into an adjacent office to unexpectedly show it to three members of another team.

I also prepared a document for the Director of Engineering concerning the App Submittal Process for Apple and Android.

Agile Methodology was used, and I wrote Stories and reported at "the SCRUM of SCRUMS."

experience.title: Founding Partner and CTO
experience.location: Santa Cruz, CA and Incline Village, NV
experience.description:
I was a founding partner and CTO for an iPhone-related site (www.MARGapps.com). The company tracked “Best of Class” Apps for mobile platforms.

Accomplishments:
* Researched and selected an appropriate open source PHP Framework with Model‑View-Controller architecture and Content Management System (Joomla, for this project), Joomla Modules and Extensions, a Source Code Control System (Subversion),  and Open Source Bug Tracking software (“Mantis”).
* Created the Database schema and wrote MySQL queries to populate and query the site's main database.
* Developed custom Modules and Templates to meet the display requirements of our Content.  Hands-on development in Javascript, jQuery, HTML, CSS, PHP and mySQL.
* Wrote an “Administrative Interface” to the Database, which heavily used AJAX and XML for communications between the client- and server-side.
* Wrote server-side PHP and mySQL queries to scrape data (price, version, and description) from the AppStore and populate a mySQL data table with each App's information.
* Integrated code and widgets for Google Analytics, Facebook and Twitter.

experience.title: Software Engineer Contractor
experience.description: - Integrated a multichannel fiber-video amplifier into a complex legacy application, which was used for remote management of large-scale video distribution networks.  I added or modified code in all four layers of the architecture: Driver, Windows application, SNMP, and Web user interface.  The web interface is consistent in layout, content, styling, behavior and browser compatibility with other devices already integrated with the legacy application.

- Used Rational ClearQuest and Rational ClearCase to identify and access the source code changed during the Japanese release testing.  The task was to gauge which source modules would need further correction for other target languages.
- Worked with management to prioritize defects, in order to maximize resources (myself and the Japanese QA tester).

experience.title: Founder
experience.description: I was the Producer of a Software Internationalization ("I18N") Instructional Presentation. I also worked with the team members to guide the choice of topics and presentation, given the available budget. I managed a team of seven. The Subject Matter Expert was Dr. William S. ("Bill") Hall. The teleplay was written by Anne Knight.  I was very satisfied with the result, the team worked heroically on the day of Production and Post-production, and the product enjoyed moderate success.

experience.title: Sr. Software Developer
experience.description:
First, I improved the memory allocation of a specialized handheld data collection meter the company manufactured, so that it could hold 8X as much data.  Also modified the PC software accordingly, and maintained backward compatibility, so "old" datasets could be read. (I think the company estimated 3 months for this task; I did it in 3 weeks.)

Then, I helped create a system to minimize human exposure to high magnetic fields. I was the Architect of the user interface of a complex CAD system. I implemented the U/I as a Windows Win32 application. The purpose of the program was to model the magnetic field strength during the design phase by altering the location, size and electrical power characteristics. The program was used with high current devices, like "high tension" wires, power substations and electric subways.

experience.title: Sr. Software Engineer (Contractor)
experience.description: Implemented an algorithm written by a Japanese expert to convert a Japanese code page to JIS, Shift JIS, and EUC format.

experience.title: Software Contractor
experience.description: I wrote a Windows application with my manager. I corrected minor issues in his code regarding memory management. This project was for a law firm, had high priority, and I worked with one of the first three optical (CD) drives in Silicon Valley, I was told.

experience.title: Consulting Analyst
experience.description: System Team Leader and Lead Programmer.  Directed the activities of two senior consultants and one permanent employee.  Specification, review, design, implementation, test and integration of system software. I wrote "the Parameter Editor," which was an important part of the next generation product.

experience.title: Senior Software Engineer
experience.description: I wrote and debugged embedded device drivers for the best Broadcast Quality Video Editing system for TV and film, the CMX-340; see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CMX_Systems . According to Wikipedia, "During the mid-1980s, CMX hardware comprised 90% of all video editing systems used for post-production video editing." It was my introduction to the Broadcast Industry. I was favorably introduced to Walter Cronkite. We chatted briefly in his tiny office filled with books.

experience.title: Senior Software Engineer
experience.description: System Engineer on the Operations Team for a unique NASA supercomputer, the IBM Advanced Signal Processor (ASP), located at Goddard Space Flight Center in Greenbelt, MD. The application was Satellite Image Processing. This was Big Data, because most satellites broadcast data almost continuously. My responsibility was to adapt the unprocessed data when out of specification blocks of images were received. I also wrote the first Utility program from our company (CSC) for this computer. My manager, Gary Hostetler, smiled and told me this, when I demonstrated the utility.

education.description:
I completed all of the coursework for a BS in Computer Science before I was admitted to the Masters in C.S. program. My studies were at the flagship campus of the University of Maryland in College Park.

Besides the required courses in Systems and Microcomputer Architecture, I took two courses with Azriel Rosenfeld, Ph.D., a pioneer in Image Processing. My MS dissertation was a RAID-like solution of using transactions to increase data reliability, with Jim Grey's IBM work. Grey was the father of Transaction Processing.

In addition to the required undergraduate Physics and Mathematics courses, I enjoyed courses in Quantum Mechanics and Astrophysics. An interest in astronomy and cosmology led me to participate in an upgrade to the radio telescope at Griffin Observatory. I worked at an offsite astronomy office in Albany, NY., where I tested detectors for a new generation of Radio Telescopes.

received_recommendations.relationship: Jasmine was rikin’s client
received_recommendations.recommendation_text:
I had the opportunity to interview with Rikin, and it was one of the best interview experiences I’ve ever had. From the start, Rikin was incredibly transparent about the expectations of the role and the future direction of the company. He openly discussed where the team currently faces challenges and how my role would be instrumental in tightening processes and driving improvement. I really appreciated his straightforward and honest approach—there were no vague answers or sugar-coating. 

What stood out most was Rikin’s clear vision for the company and his ability to communicate that vision in a way that inspires confidence and excitement. His candid insights into the team’s areas for growth gave me a real sense of the impact I could make and where I could bring value. It’s rare to find someone who is not only focused on success but also genuinely invested in building a better team and product.

Overall, the experience left a lasting impression. I would highly recommend working with Rikin for anyone looking to be part of a dynamic, evolving company under a leader who values transparency and collaboration.

basic_info.headline: Founder @Collective. Former Udemy, MBX (YCW14). Building something new.
basic_info.about:
I'm an entrepreneur and hands-on product leader with design and engineering background. I’ve built award winning products over the past 17 years. I'm experienced in designing products that work and scale efficiently across platforms. I like to seed design thinking and product-lead growth in organizations, regardless of their size.

In 2018 I founded Collective with a mission to redefine the way businesses-of-one work. Collective is backed by General Catalyst, Google's Gradient Ventures, QED, Expa, Ashton Kutcher and more.

In 2015 I joined the YC startup MBX ($200M in funding) as VP of Product Design. I built and lead a team that designed an end-to-end beauty and e-commerce experience.

In 2013 I came to the US to help building Udemy (NASDAQ:UDMY), now a public and one of the largest online education platforms with more than 40 million students around the world. 

In 2010 I was the Head of Android Business at Elisa (HEL: ELISA), one of the largest public telecom operators in Finland. During my management, Elisa took over the largest Android market share and pioneered a local mobile ecosystem.

I’ve done notable product and design work at Google Express and Angry Birds, and was listed among “64 people you should know in design”, together with design leaders of Uber, Stripe, Google, Airbnb, Facebook, Slack, Lyft, and Medium.

We're building the future of work. Our mission is to redefine the way businesses-of-one work.

Collective is an online platform to give self-employed people the technology and team they need so they can focus on their passion, not their paperwork. Collective handles company formation, taxes, accounting, bookkeeping and more.

We’re backed by General Catalyst, QED, Google’s Gradient Ventures, Expa and prominent investors who have financed and built iconic companies like Uber, Stripe, Snap, Udemy, Lyft, Instacart and more.

basic_info.headline: Founder, CEO and CBO at Insilico Medicine
basic_info.about:
My posts and articles here are strictly personal, not reflective of positions or policies of Insilico Medicine, which disclaims any responsibility for my individual statements.

I am also 100% focused on extending healthy, productive life for everyone on the planet. By citizenship, I am Canadian and Latvian. Any kind of war is against my religion, and I can not support any kind of war, military action, or disturbance of peace. I believe that countries and people need to work together to fight diseases and make the world more sustainable.

In 2014, I founded Insilico Medicine (www.insilico.com) a global clinical-stage generative AI drug discovery. Until 2019, it was an AI-first drug discovery company, with most of the team focused exclusively on developing and applying deep learning methods to drug discovery. Insilico is the original inventor of multiple drug discovery technologies with multiple granted and pending patents in biomarker development and generative chemistry and generative biology. In 2019 the company started working on its own therapeutic programs focusing predominantly on immunology, oncology, fibrosis, and CNS. It also made its industrial-strength target discovery platforms (PandaOmics) and generative chemistry (Chemistry42) platforms available for licensing and partnering. It raised over $500 million from expert healthcare, biotechnology, and technology investors, and entered 2 Phase II clinical trials with the novel target discovered using AI and novel molecule designed using AI. Since 2019, Insilico nominated 22 preclinical candidates, 10 reached clinical stage, 1 completed Phase 2a. 

I also founded, co-chair and personally sponsor the largest global non-profit conference on aging research and drug discovery - Aging Research and Drug Discovery (ARDD), www.AgingPharma.org. In 2024, the University of Copenhagen will host 11th annual ARDD - please register early as it usually sells out in advance. 

Life positioning statement: 
www.LongevityPledge.org

Publication record: 
http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/?term=zhavoronkov+a 
https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=8Icccp0AAAAJ&hl=en

Forbes.com articles: 
https://www.forbes.com/sites/alexzhavoronkov/ 

My book is out in English, Japanese, Chinese, and Polish: 
"The Ageless Generation: How Advances in Biomedicine Will Transform the Global Economy", Palgrave Macmillan, NY, 2013
http://www.amazon.com/The-Ageless-Generation-Biomedicine-Transform/dp/0230342205/

Email:              alex@insilico.com 
FB:                    /biogerontology
Twitter:          @biogerontology

experience.title: Chief Executive Officer and Chief Business Officer
experience.description: Since founding Insilico Medicine I explored multiple business models, partnership and collaboration strategies as the company evolved from algorithms to software to assets to fully-integrated agile biotech with massive automated labs and real drug discovery benchmarks. I am now expanding my role to transform the way business development in the pharmaceutical industry with the help of generative AI and new leadership style.

experience.title: Founder and CEO
experience.description:
Insilico Medicine (www.insilico.com) is a global clinical-stage generative AI-powered drug discovery and development company founded in 2014. Until 2019 it was an AI-first drug discovery company with most of the team focused exclusively on developing and applying deep learning methods to drug discovery focusing on generative approaches. Insilico is the original inventor of multiple drug discovery technologies with multiple granted and pending patents in biomarker development, generative chemistry, and generative biology. In 2019 the company started working on its own therapeutic programs focusing predominantly on immunology, oncology, fibrosis, CNS, metabolic diseases, and pain. It also made its industrial-strength target discovery platforms (PandaOmics) and generative chemistry (Chemistry42) platforms available for licensing and partnering. It raised over $400 million from expert healthcare, biotechnology, and technology investors, nominated 22 preclinical candidates, 10 programs reached clinical stage. One program completed Phase IIa with good safety and unexpected dose-dependent efficacy in IPF with the novel target discovered using generative AI and novel molecule designed using generative AI. 

Recent blog: 
https://insilico.com/phase1

experience.title: Scientific Advisor
experience.description: Provided valuable scientific advice and guidance to a group of bright young AI scientists on machine vision for skincare research especially in the context of aging and longevity.  Advised the company CEO, Anastasia Georgievskaya, a brilliant former student and research collaborator on starting a company. Provided the team with personal research grants at first and then with seed funding to start a company and produce the MVP. Participated in several research projects related to tracking wrinkle formation, assessment of subjective age and appearance, balancing of the datasets, and series of tests to ensure race-agnostic system performance.

experience.title: Chief Longevity Officer
experience.description:
Deep Longevity was acquired by Regent Pacific (HK: 0575) and my title has changed to Chief Longevity Officer. In this advisory capacity, I am advising the development of new biomarkers of aging and longevity.

Deep Longevity spun out of Insilico Medicine, independently raised the round A of funding, launched the Young.ai app and Young.ai web services, partnered with multiple clinics and launched an educational course.

experience.title: Founder and CEO
experience.description:
At Insilico Medicine I invented and co-invented a range of biomarkers of aging and longevity utilizing modern artificial intelligence techniques, published seminal papers, and filed for patents some of which were granted. We also discovered several mechanisms driving the aging process and invented interventions targeting these mechanisms. Deep Longevity was incubated by Insilico Medicine to further develop and commercialize these aging clocks and help power the nascent longevity biotechnology industry.   
Deep Longevity is developing explainable artificial intelligence systems to track the rate of aging at the molecular, cellular, tissue, organ, system, physiological, and psychological levels. It is also developing systems for the emerging field of longevity medicine enabling physicians to make better decisions on the interventions that may slow down, or reverse the aging processes. Deep Longevity developed Longevity as a Service (LaaS)© solution to integrate multiple deep biomarkers of aging dubbed “deep aging clocks” to provide a universal multifactorial measure of human biological age. Originally incubated by Insilico Medicine, Deep Longevity started its independent journey in 2020 after securing a round of funding from the most credible venture capitalists specializing in biotechnology, longevity, and artificial intelligence. ETP Ventures, Human Longevity and Performance Impact Venture Fund, BOLD Capital Partners, Longevity Vision Fund, LongeVC, co-founder of Oculus, Michael Antonov, and other expert AI and biotechnology investors supported the company. Deep Longevity established a research partnership with one of the most prominent longevity organizations, Human Longevity, Inc. to provide a range of aging clocks to the network of advanced physicians and researchers.

Today we monitor about $1 trillion dollars worth of grant funding linked to researchers and academic publications.

We funded a number of projects in regenerative medicine, supported conferences, and produced analytical reports. In 2016-/2017 I had to stop active involvement with the charity to focus exclusively on Insilico Medicine.  
The Biogerontology Research Foundation (registered UK charity #1124054) is funding research to develop interventions that remediate the molecular damage underlying the diseases of ageing. To partner or get involved, please don't hesitate to contact the trustees.
